intro: Pleurothallis alborosea, commonly known as the white rose orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and革质 (leathery), and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its beauty and rarity, it is often sought after by orchid enthusiasts and is considered a valuable addition to botanical collections.
